title.rendered: How to Start a Handyman Business: A Complete Guide

content.rendered:
Are you spending your weekends fixing things around the house maybe repairing a broken fence, installing light fixtures, or tackling some small home repairs?

At first, it’s just something you do to keep things in shape or help out friends and family. But as you get better at it, you start to see the potential. 

What if this skill could become more than just weekend projects? 

What if you could turn it into a business?

If you’ve ever thought about how your weekend handyman skills could help others.

Yes, you’re already on the path to starting your own business with low startup costs. 

In this blog, we will guide you through how to start a handyman business and cover everything from planning to execution.

If you are already interested in the handyman business or are new to this field, and want a handyman business startup guide. This blog will hopefully provide you with all the answers you need.

What is a Handyman Business?

A handyman business provides a range of home maintenance and repair services. These services can include anything from fixing leaky faucets to installing drywall or even assembling furniture. Handymen are usually skilled in a variety of trades and can offer clients a one-stop solution for all their repair and maintenance needs.

Many handyman businesses are run part-time, which gives business owners the flexibility to manage other responsibilities while serving their customers. The wide range of services offered makes handyman businesses popular with homeowners who need reliable help with their home projects.

Is Starting a Handyman Business Profitable?

Yes, starting a handyman business can be quite profitable. Especially when you take the time to understand the market, your customers’ needs, and how to price your services correctly. 

As the demand for maintenance and repair services continues to rise, many people prefer hiring a handyman for small tasks rather than dealing with larger contractors. 

The ability to cater to a wide range of needs and the relatively low startup cost compared to other businesses make it an attractive option for entrepreneurs.

Benefits of Starting a Handyman Business

  • Low Startup Costs: Starting a handyman business doesn’t require a big investment. You can start small and grow as you gain more clients and experience.
  • Flexibility: You can work on your own schedule and choose how many projects to take on.
  • High Demand: There is always a need for home repair services, from fixing appliances to major renovations.
  • Skill Variety: You can offer different services, like plumbing or carpentry, making your work more interesting and diverse.

What is The Cost of Starting a Handyman Business?

The initial investment for launching a handyman business can vary significantly based on factors like the size of your business, your location, the types of services you plan to offer, and whether you already own key equipment like tools or a vehicle.

13 Steps to Start a Handyman Business?

Starting a handyman business requires a step-by-step approach to make sure you address all the important aspects of the venture. Here are 13 key steps to guide you in getting your business up and running successfully.

Choose the Service You Want to Provide

Not all handymen offer the same services. Decide which types of services you’ll offer based on your skill set. Common handyman services include plumbing, electrical work, carpentry, painting, and general repairs. Focusing on specific areas will allow you to build a reputation in a niche market.

Once you decide on the services you want to offer, take some time to research other handyman businesses in your area. This will help you understand the local market and how much they charge. Knowing this information will allow you to position your business better and stand out from the competition. 

Make a Business Plan 

A business plan is essential for outlining your business goals, target market, services, and financial projections. It’s a roadmap for your business and will help you make informed decisions as you grow. Your plan should also include strategies for marketing, customer acquisition, and pricing your services.

Secure Your Startup Costs

It is important to secure the startup costs for your handyman business. Depending on the services you offer, you’ll need money for tools, insurance, marketing, and other expenses. 

Start by figuring out how much money you’ll need to get your business up and running. This will help you find ways to fund your business, like using personal savings, loans, or investors.

It’s important to keep your startup costs low to avoid financial problems early on. 

Make a budget that shows what you expect to spend and how much you expect to earn. This will help you manage your business finances and make sure you have enough money for the necessary expenses.

On average, the cost to start a handyman business ranges from $49,000 to $160,000.  But it depends on the size of the business.

Choose a Company Name

Choosing a company name is an important step in starting your handyman business. Your name should reflect your services and be easy for customers to remember. A good name can help you stand out and look professional. When thinking of names, try to include words related to your handyman services, which can also help people find you online.

Before you choose any name, remember this- 

  • Check Name Availability: Ensure the name isn’t already taken by another business.
  • Domain Availability: Verify if the website domain is available if you plan to create a site.
  • Branding Importance: Choose a name that fits your business and resonates with your target customers.

After choosing a business name, the next step is to register your handyman business. You’ll need to register your business name with the local government in your state. This usually means filling out some forms and paying a small fee.

Get the Required Licence

To run your handyman business legally, you’ll need to get the right licenses and permits. These can differ based on where you live and the types of services you offer. In many areas, you’ll need a contractor’s license, especially if you plan to do specialized work like plumbing or electrical repairs.

If you’re wondering how to become a licensed handyman, it’s essential to research the specific licensing requirements in your state to make sure you follow the proper steps.

Getting the right licenses not only allows you to work legally but also makes customers feel more confident in hiring your company.

Purchase Tools and Equipment  

The right tools and equipment are crucial for running a successful handyman business.

Make a list of the tools you’ll need to get started, so you have everything required to handle the tasks you offer.

Also, investing in good-quality tools can help you work more efficiently and do a better job. Some basic tools like-

  • Hammer
  • Screwdrivers (Flathead and Phillips)
  • Tape Measure
  • Cordless Drill
  • Pliers (Needle-nose and regular)
  • Adjustable Wrench
  • Utility Knife
  • Level
  • Handsaw
  • Stud Finder
  • Allen Wrenches (Hex Keys)
  • Ladder
  • Work Gloves
  • Flashlight or Headlamp
  • Caulking Gun
  • Power Sander
  • Shop Vacuum
  • Socket Set
  • Portable Tool Box

As a new handyman, it’s a good idea to start with the basic tools you need and gradually add more as your business grows. 

Set Prices

You need to find a balance between offering affordable rates for your customers while ensuring you make a good profit. Research what other handymen in your area are charging for similar services and adjust your prices accordingly.

Make sure you consider your costs, such as tools, insurance, and travel expenses, so you can set prices that cover these and leave room for profit. 

By setting competitive and fair prices, you can attract customers and ensure your business is profitable in the long run.

Secure Insurance

Getting insurance is an important step to protect your handyman business from possible problems. General liability insurance is a must because it covers any damages or injuries that might happen while you’re working at a customer’s property. Having insurance not only protects you but also shows customers that you are professional and trustworthy.

If you plan to hire workers, you should also look into getting workers’ compensation insurance to protect your employees.

Good insurance coverage gives you peace of mind, so you can focus on doing great work without worrying about accidents or unexpected costs.

When looking for insurance, compare quotes from different companies to find the best deal. By investing in the right insurance, you make your business stronger and build trust with your clients.

Ensure Technology and Tools

Along with having the right physical tools, it’s important to invest in technology to run your handyman business smoothly. Using the right software can help you manage everything you want. A good software solution saves you time, keeps your business organized, and makes you look more professional to your customers.

It’s also important to create a website for your handyman business. A website acts like your online shop where potential customers can learn about your services, read reviews, and contact you easily. 

A simple, clean, and mobile-friendly website can help you attract more clients and grow your business.

Hire & Train Employees

If your business grows, you may need to hire employees to help with projects. Hiring skilled workers is important, and training them to provide excellent service and adhere to your business standards will ensure your business maintains a good reputation.

Offer Outstanding Customer Service

Great customer service can set you apart from competitors, also it is a cornerstone of a successful handyman business. 

For offering great customer service –

  • Build strong relationships with your clients to encourage repeat business and referrals.
  • Communicate effectively with customers and ensure clear and polite conversations.
  • Respond quickly to customer inquiries and follow up after completing jobs to ensure satisfaction.
  • Be open to feedback and continuously improve your services based on what customers suggest.
  • Offer a satisfaction guarantee to enhance your credibility and make clients feel more confident in your services.

Marketing Your Business

Marketing your handyman business is key to attracting new customers and growing your client base. Start by building a strong online presence with a professional website that shows your services, customer reviews, and contact details. 

Offering special deals or discounts can attract more clients, especially when you’re just starting. 

Consider running promotions like a discount for first-time customers or seasonal offers to encourage people to try your services. 

Here, if you choose Demandium for your software solution, you also get a promotional management system for your business. You don’t need to hire a marketing team for marketing or branding your business.

Keep Monitoring Your Business

Monitoring your handyman business is important to make sure it keeps growing and running smoothly. Regularly check your finances, track your spending, and see how much profit you’re making. 

Also, stay updated on industry trends and any changes in regulations that may affect your business.

Keep an eye on your marketing efforts and listen to customer feedback to understand what’s working and what isn’t. This will help you make smart decisions and adjust your strategies when needed.

Challenges You May Face in a Handyman Business

While starting a handyman business can be rewarding, there are a few challenges to consider:

What Not to Do When Starting Your Handyman Business

When starting your handyman business, there are several pitfalls to avoid to ensure your venture’s success. 

  • Don’t forget to get the necessary licenses and insurance. Operating without them can lead to legal and financial problems.
  • Avoid starting without a clear business plan. 

Not having one can leave you unprepared for challenges and limit your growth.

  • Don’t use inconsistent or vague pricing. It can confuse customers and hurt your reputation. Set competitive rates based on the quality of your work.
  • Never depend just on referrals. 

It’s important to actively market your business to reach more potential customers.

Conclusion

There is no doubt that starting a handyman business can be a great way to earn money. Especially if you enjoy working with your hands and helping people around your community.

Hopefully, I’ve answered all your questions about how to start a handyman business. By following the steps in this guide, you’ll be on the right track to get your business up and running. 

With time and effort, you can build a handyman business that supports your community and helps people improve their homes. Stay focused on your goals and keep learning as you go!

FAQs

How to become a licensed handyman?

To become a licensed handyman, you’ll need to check the requirements in your local area, as each region has different rules. Generally, you’ll need to pass a licensing exam, have some experience, and sometimes even provide proof of insurance.

What are some handyman business advertising ideas?

To advertise your handyman business, consider these ideas:

Online marketing: Use Google Ads or social media platforms like Facebook and Instagram to reach your local audience.

Flyers and business cards: Leave them in local coffee shops, libraries, and community centers.

Word of mouth: Offer discounts or incentives for customers who refer you to others.

How to price handyman services?

When pricing handyman services, there are two main methods:

Hourly rates: Typically, handymen charge $50 to $100 per hour, depending on the job complexity and location.

Flat rates: For simpler tasks like installing a light fixture, you can charge a flat fee ($75 for a small job). Always consider costs like travel time, materials, and any additional overhead costs when setting your rates.

What are the best tools for starting a handyman business?

The best tools for starting a handyman business include:

– Cordless drill & bits

– Measuring tape & level

– Screwdrivers & pliers

– Hammer & utility knife

– Saw (either manual or electric)

– Wrenches and sockets

How to create a handyman website?

To create a handyman website, use website builders like Wix, WordPress, or Squarespace. Ensure the website includes:

Services page: List the specific handyman services you offer.

About page: Share information about your experience and business background.

Contact page: Include your phone number, email, and a contact form.

Customer reviews/testimonials: Show positive feedback from past clients.

Portfolio: Display before-and-after pictures of projects you’ve completed.

What types of odd jobs can I offer as a handyman?

As a handyman, you can offer a variety of odd jobs, including minor repairs, home improvement projects, painting, landscaping, and furniture assembly. Defining your skills will help you target the right customers and market your services effectively.
